newsitem.title: ITALY: Italy cabinet approves incentives for car sector.
newsitem.headline: Italy cabinet approves incentives for car sector.

text.p: The Italian cabinet approved incentives on Monday to scrap cars more than 10 years old in an effort to boost the flagging car sector, Prime Minister Romano Prodi said.
Prodi told a news conference after a cabinet meeting the measures would be in force for nine months and would operate as discount for people scrapping cars and buying new ones.
"A contribution will be introduced for nine months for the purchase of cars and linked to the scrapping of vehicles which are more than 10 years old," Prodi said.
"The contribution will be paid in the form of a discount in which the producers will make to the client," he said.
Prodi said the contribution would be up to 1.5 million lire for vehicles with engines of less than 1,300 cc and up to 2.0 million lire for those larger than 1,300 cc.
The measures are part of an end-of-year fiscal decree which is itself part of the 1997 budget. The measures must still be approved by parliament.
